name: Harry Waxman
biography: Harry Waxman, B.S.C. (3 April 1912 â€“ 24 December 1984) was an English cinematographer.Born in London, Waxman won an award from the British Society of Cinematographers for Sapphire in 1959. His other films included Brighton Rock (1947), Swiss Family Robinson (1960), The Day the Earth Caught Fire (1961), Crooks in Cloisters (1964), The Nanny (1965), The Anniversary (1968), and The Wicker Man (1973).Waxman served as a cinematographer in the RAF film unit during World War II.
